info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:28PM EDT until April 01 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT FOR ALLEN...NORTHEASTERN HUNTINGTON AND WESTERN PAULDING COUNTIES... At 1127 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Auburn to Fort Wayne to near Ossian, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Fort Wayne, New Haven, Huntertown, Paulding, Antwerp, Woodburn, Monroeville, Payne, Grabill, Aboite, Leo-cedarville, Middletown, Roanoke, Dixon, Latty, Cecil, Yoder, Edgerton In Allen County, Zulu and Mcgill. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 294 and 321. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for northeastern Indiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for west central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
